verses.text: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece \add of flesh\add*, and a flagon \add of wine\add*.
And he appointed \add certain\add* of the Levites to minister before the ark of the \sc Lord\sc*, and to record, and to thank and praise the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel:

Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
Then on that day David delivered first \add this psalm\add* to thank the \sc Lord\sc* into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
Give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*, call upon his name, Make known his deeds among the people.
Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him, Talk you of all his wondrous works.
Glory ye in his holy name: Let the heart of them rejoice that seek the \sc Lord\sc*.
Seek the \sc Lord\sc* and his strength, Seek his face continually.
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
O ye seed of Israel his servant, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen \add ones\add*.
He \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc* our God; His judgments \add are\add* in all the earth.
Be ye mindful always of his covenant; The word \add which\add* he commanded to a thousand generations;
\add Even of the covenant\add* which he made with Abraham, And of his oath unto Isaac;
And hath confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, \add And\add* to Israel \add for\add* an everlasting covenant,
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance;
When ye were \add but\add* few, Even a few, and strangers in it.
And \add when\add* they went from nation to nation, And from \add one\add* kingdom to another people;
He suffered no man to do them wrong: Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
\add Saying\add*, Touch not mine anointed, And do my prophets no harm.
Sing unto the \sc Lord\sc*, all the earth; Shew forth from day to day his salvation.
Declare his glory among the heathen; His marvellous works among all nations.
For great \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, and greatly to be praised: He also \add is\add* to be feared above all gods.
For all the gods of the people \add are\add* idols: But the \sc Lord\sc* made the heavens.
Glory and honour \add are\add* in his presence; Strength and gladness \add are\add* in his place.
Give unto the \sc Lord\sc*, ye kindreds of the people, Give unto the \sc Lord\sc* glory and strength.
Give unto the \sc Lord\sc* the glory due unto his name: Bring an offering, and come before him: Worship the \sc Lord\sc* in the beauty of holiness.
Fear before him, all the earth: The world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: And let \add men\add* say among the nations, The \sc Lord\sc* reigneth.
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof: Let the fields rejoice, and all that \add is\add* therein.
Then shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the \sc Lord\sc*, Because he cometh to judge the earth.
O give thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*; for \add he is\add* good; For his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever.
And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, And gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, That \add we\add* may give thanks to thy holy name, \add And\add* glory in thy praise.
Blessed \add be\add* the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the \sc Lord\sc*.
So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the \sc Lord\sc* Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every dayâ€™s work required:
and Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:
and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the \sc Lord\sc* in the high place that \add was\add* at Gibeon,

to offer burnt offerings unto the \sc Lord\sc* upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, and \add to do\add* according to all that is written in the law of the \sc Lord\sc*, which he commanded Israel;
and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the \sc Lord\sc*, because his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever;
and with them Heman and Jeduthun \add with\add* trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun \add were\add* porters.
And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
